ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Dudley - Page
ai_page.body:
Adaptations and home improvements

If you are disabled or are having difficulty getting around your home, there may be ways in which we can help you to live more independently. This could be through advice, small adaptations, or a disabled facilities grant for larger work to your home.

What help is available?

  • Adaptations, aids and equipment – Support for daily living including stair rails, ramps, grab rails and other minor adjustments to your home.
  • Disabled Facilities Grant – Financial assistance towards the cost of larger adaptations such as showers, stair lifts, widening doors, and access improvements.
  • Handyperson Service – Small practical jobs to support independent living, like fitting locks or curtain rails (for people who are elderly, disabled or vulnerable).

Who can get help?

You could get help if you or someone who lives with you is disabled or is struggling to live independently due to age or illness, and you are:

  • A Dudley borough resident (homeowner or tenant)
  • Living in your own home, private rented, or a housing association property
  • In need of adaptations or equipment to support independent living

How to apply

To discuss your needs and request an assessment, you can:

  • Contact the Access and Prevention Team on 0300 555 0050
  • Email: dachs@dudley.gov.uk

Useful information

  • Home repairs and maintenance
  • Housing Assistance Policy
  • Application forms
